definition[0]: to make cloth, a carpet, a basket etc by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom
example[1]: Only a few of the women still weave.
definition[1]: to put many different ideas, subjects, stories etc together and connect them smoothly
example[3]: She weaves a complicated plot of romance and intrigue.
example[4]: the complex patterns which evolve when individualsâ€™ lives are woven together
definition[2]: to move somewhere by turning and changing direction a lot
example[5]: cyclists weaving in and out of the traffic
example[6]: Lori spotted them as they weaved their way through the tables.
note[1]: weave your way through/to etc something
definition[3]: the way in which a material is woven, and the pattern formed by this
